cab.content: Printed for the Cabinet. June 1945.78SECRET.Copy No.CP. (45) 22.Qth June, 1945.v cabinet.EMERGENCY BUSINESS COMMITTEE.Minute by the Prime Minister.I have appointed a Committee consisting of Lord Swinton (Chairman).Lord Margesson.Sir James Edmondson, M.P.This Committee will be available to perform functions analogous to thoseof the Emergency Business Committee which has been appointed by the Cabinetduring the last five General Elections. The Committee will interpret points inthe Party Declaration and will suggest answers to questions in accordancetherewith which may crop up during the General Election.The quorum of the Committee will be two and it will, of course, have powerto co-opt individual Ministers or their representatives for the discussion ofparticular matters.Mr. W. S. Murrie of the Cabinet Offices will act as Secretary to theCommittee.W. S. C.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,Qth June, 1945.[30034]
